result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. Wiese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No contact with Fleet Farm, Menards or Old Castle.
Good faith effort to maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse A. Wiese

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order for Payment and Reimbursement to County sent to judge.
Re: Order for payment and reimbursement to county

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 2:06 p.m. 
INCLUDES 20CF728, 20CF1346, 20CM396, 20CM975, 21CF1115 and 22CF825.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dylan Resch. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing on call cases; waiver of prelim in 22CF825; VRCW.  

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing>>22CF825.
Waiver of Prelim filed (Doc 6); COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information e-filed.  

Plea/Sentencing>>>
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

20CF728>>State moves to AMEND Count 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take >=$500-$5000) to Misdemeanor Retail Theft under 943.50(1m)(b); COURT grants. 

20CF1346>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Operating While Revoked); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants.  
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants.

20CM975>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Operating While Revoked); COURT grants. 

21CF1115>>State moves to DRI:  
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 3 (Operating While Revoked); COURT grants. 
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants.

22CF825>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 6 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants.


PLEA: 

20CF728>>Count 1 (Misd Retail Theft-Intentionally Take): GUILTY. 

20CM396>>Count 1 (Misd Retail Theft-Intentionally Take): GUILTY. 

21CF1115>>Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor): GUILTY. 

22CF825>>Count 4 (Theft-Movable Property <=$2500): GUILTY.  
22CF825>>Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor): GUILTY. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation; concurrent with each other.  

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  Good faith effort at maintaining FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No contact with Menards, Fleet Farm or Old Castle.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Restitution (20CF728) in the amount of $856.97 to Menards, including 10% surcharge.  Restitution (20CM396) in the amount of $349.99 to Fleet Farm, including 10% surcharge. 

Adj:  2:29 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
